page.title: 05EDINBANE SCHOOL - PRESENT
page.content: Today the twenty pupils in Edinbane Primary are taught in two classes until they transfer top Portree High School after Primary Seven. They enjoy lessons from the visiting art teacher and Gaelic teacher for this school is taking part in the Bilingual Project. As in city schools we have computer lessons, television, tape recorders and radio, but we also have the moor, river, hillside and woods for outdoor work and games. In basic subject the children progress at their own rate, while in others a three or four year cycle of lessons is used. Today children are healthy, well-dressed, well-fed and full of energy. They are keen members of the Junior Red Cross and enjoy visiting the old folk in Gesto Hospital.
